intro: Racosperma assimile, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattled legume, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to brown flowers. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Racosperma assimile plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
